reviews.text: Not very well kept and appealing train station and often causes major congestion for Hampden park. Its alright for if you need a train and you live in hampden park (or near).
Late trains, delays and high drop from the train to the platform if you have a travel system or twins like me.
This is a good little station for the residents of hampden park and the surrounding areas. This has not got a ticket barrier and has a little alley for people to get to Farady Close

This station is situated nicely in Hampden park (East Sussex) with services to Eastbourne, Ore, Ashford Int', Brighton and London Victoria. NOT ALL TRAINS STOP AT THIS STATION! There doesn't seem to be a pattern to when trains stop at this station. the facilities are pretty poor. when asking to use the toilet I was instructed to walk down the road and use public toilets despite there being a disabled toilet in the station. There is a ticket office which seems to be open when ever convenient to southern and does not cooperate with the opening schedule.
Small station with no ticket barriers. Good links to Hastings, Brighton and London.
